1901230.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901230
In-book reference  : Book 18, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 18, Hadith 001
1901230.text: Abu Huraira said: "I have not seen anything more beautiful than Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace). The sun seemed to shine in his face. Nor have I seen anyone more rapid in his gait than Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace). The earth seemed to be folded up for him. We must strenuously exert ourselves, while he is not subject to any stress."

1901240.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901240
In-book reference  : Book 18, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 18, Hadith 002
1901240.text: Ibrahim ibn Muhammad, one of the offspring of 'Ali ibn Abi Talib, told me: “When "Ali described the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace), he said: ‘When he walked, he moved as if he were descending a declivity'.”

1901250.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901250
In-book reference  : Book 18, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 18, Hadith 003
1901250.text: Ali ibn Abi Talib said (may Allah ennoble his countenance): "When the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) walked, he inclined forward as if he were descending a declivity.”
